info.title: FortiOS CMDB
info.description: REST API for configuring FortiOS objects and settings

tags.name: switch-controller.acl/group
tags.description: Configure ACL groups to be applied on managed FortiSwitch ports.

tags.name: switch-controller.acl/ingress
tags.description: Configure ingress ACL policies to be applied on managed FortiSwitch ports.

tags.name: switch-controller.auto-config/custom
tags.description: Policies which can override the 'default' for specific ISL/ICL/FortiLink interface.

tags.name: switch-controller.auto-config/default
tags.description: Policies which are applied automatically to all ISL/ICL/FortiLink interfaces.

tags.name: switch-controller.auto-config/policy
tags.description: Policy definitions which can define the behavior on auto configured interfaces.

tags.name: switch-controller.initial-config/template
tags.description: Configure template for auto-generated VLANs.

tags.name: switch-controller.initial-config/vlans
tags.description: Configure initial template for auto-generated VLAN interfaces.

tags.name: switch-controller.ptp/interface-policy
tags.description: PTP interface-policy configuration.

tags.name: switch-controller.ptp/profile
tags.description: Global PTP profile.

tags.name: switch-controller.qos/dot1p-map
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch QoS 802.1p.

tags.name: switch-controller.qos/ip-dscp-map
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch QoS IP precedence/DSCP.

tags.name: switch-controller.qos/qos-policy
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch QoS policy.

tags.name: switch-controller.qos/queue-policy
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch QoS egress queue policy.

tags.name: switch-controller.security-policy/802-1X
tags.description: Configure 802.1x MAC Authentication Bypass (MAB) policies.

tags.name: switch-controller.security-policy/local-access
tags.description: Configure allowaccess list for mgmt and internal interfaces on managed FortiSwitch units.

tags.name: switch-controller/802-1X-settings
tags.description: Configure global 802.1X settings.

tags.name: switch-controller/custom-command
tags.description: Configure the FortiGate switch controller to send custom commands to managed FortiSwitch devices.

tags.name: switch-controller/dynamic-port-policy
tags.description: Configure Dynamic port policy to be applied on the managed FortiSwitch ports through DPP device.

tags.name: switch-controller/flow-tracking
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch flow tracking and export via ipfix/netflow.

tags.name: switch-controller/fortilink-settings
tags.description: Configure integrated FortiLink settings for FortiSwitch.

tags.name: switch-controller/global
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch global settings.

tags.name: switch-controller/igmp-snooping
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch IGMP snooping global settings.

tags.name: switch-controller/ip-source-guard-log
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch ip source guard log.

tags.name: switch-controller/lldp-profile
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch LLDP profiles.

tags.name: switch-controller/lldp-settings
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch LLDP settings.

tags.name: switch-controller/location
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch location services.

tags.name: switch-controller/mac-policy
tags.description: Configure MAC policy to be applied on the managed FortiSwitch devices through NAC device.

tags.name: switch-controller/managed-switch
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch devices that are managed by this FortiGate.

tags.name: switch-controller/network-monitor-settings
tags.description: Configure network monitor settings.

tags.name: switch-controller/remote-log
tags.description: Configure logging by FortiSwitch device to a remote syslog server.

tags.name: switch-controller/sflow
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch sFlow.

tags.name: switch-controller/snmp-community
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch SNMP v1/v2c communities globally.

tags.name: switch-controller/snmp-sysinfo
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch SNMP system information globally.

tags.name: switch-controller/snmp-trap-threshold
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch SNMP trap threshold values globally.

tags.name: switch-controller/snmp-user
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch SNMP v3 users globally.

tags.name: switch-controller/storm-control
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch storm control.

tags.name: switch-controller/storm-control-policy
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch storm control policy to be applied on managed-switch ports.

tags.name: switch-controller/stp-instance
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch multiple spanning tree protocol (MSTP) instances.

tags.name: switch-controller/stp-settings
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch spanning tree protocol (STP).

tags.name: switch-controller/switch-group
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch switch groups.

tags.name: switch-controller/switch-interface-tag
tags.description: Configure switch object tags.

tags.name: switch-controller/switch-log
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch logging (logs are transferred to and inserted into FortiGate event log).

tags.name: switch-controller/switch-profile
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch switch profile.

tags.name: switch-controller/system
tags.description: Configure system-wide switch controller settings.

tags.name: switch-controller/traffic-policy
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch traffic policy.

tags.name: switch-controller/traffic-sniffer
tags.description: Configure FortiSwitch RSPAN/ERSPAN traffic sniffing parameters.

tags.name: switch-controller/virtual-port-pool
tags.description: Configure virtual pool.

tags.name: switch-controller/vlan-policy
tags.description: Configure VLAN policy to be applied on the managed FortiSwitch ports through dynamic-port-policy.

get.summary:
Select a specific entry from a CLI table.
 Access Group: wifi

ingress.description: Configure ingress ACL policies in group.

400.description: Bad Request: Request cannot be processed by the API

401.description: Not Authorized: Request without successful login session

403.description: Forbidden: Request is missing CSRF token or administrator is missing access profile permissions.

404.description: Resource Not Found: Unable to find the specified resource.

405.description: Method Not Allowed: Specified HTTP method is not allowed for this resource.

413.description: Request Entity Too Large: Request cannot be processed due to large entity

424.description: Failed Dependency: Fail dependency can be duplicate resource, missing required parameter, missing required attribute, invalid attribute value

429.description: Access temporarily blocked: Maximum failed authentications reached. The offended source is temporarily blocked for certain amount of time.

500.description: Internal Server Error: Internal error when processing the request

parameters.name: attr
parameters.description: Attribute name that references other table

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

parameters.name: skip_to_datasource
parameters.description: Skip to provided table's Nth entry. E.g {datasource: 'firewall.address', pos: 10, global_entry: false}

parameters.name: acs
parameters.description: If true, returned result are in ascending order.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: If present, the objects will be filtered by the search value.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope [global|vdom|both*]

parameters.name: datasource
parameters.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

parameters.name: with_meta
parameters.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
datasource: Return all applicable datasource entries for a specific attribute based on simulate data.
stats: Return CMDB aggregated statistics.
find-index: Return indexes of provided primary keys with respect to filter.
default: Return the CLI default values for this object type.
json-schema: Return the JSON Schema for this object type.
schema: Return the CLI schema for this object type.
revision: Return the CMDB revision for this object type.
transaction-list: List all configuration transaction(s).
transaction-show: Show the content of the configuration transaction by transcation ID.

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: mkey

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

7.name: format
7.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

8.name: filter
8.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

9.name: key
9.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

10.name: pattern
10.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

13.name: datasource_format
13.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

14.name: skip_to
14.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

15.name: unfiltered_count
15.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: nkey
parameters.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

8.name: filter
8.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

8.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

security-mode.description:
Port or MAC based 802.1X security mode.   
802.1X:802.1X port based authentication.   
802.1X-mac-based:802.1X MAC based authentication.

user-group.description: Name of user-group to assign to this MAC Authentication Bypass (MAB) policy.

mac-auth-bypass.description:
Enable/disable MAB for this policy.   
disable:Disable MAB.   
enable:Enable MAB.

auth-order.description:
Configure authentication order.   
dot1x-mab:Use EAP 1X authentication first then MAB.   
mab-dot1x:Use MAB authentication first then EAP 1X.   
mab:Use MAB authentication only.

auth-priority.description:
Configure authentication priority.   
legacy:EAP 1X authentication has a higher priority than MAB with the legacy implementation.   
dot1x-mab:EAP 1X authentication has a higher priority than MAB.   
mab-dot1x:MAB authentication has a higher priority than EAP 1X.

open-auth.description:
Enable/disable open authentication for this policy.   
disable:Disable open authentication.   
enable:Enable open authentication.

eap-passthru.description:
Enable/disable EAP pass-through mode, allowing protocols (such as LLDP) to pass through ports for more flexible authentication.   
disable:Disable EAP pass-through mode on this interface.   
enable:Enable EAP pass-through mode on this interface.

eap-auto-untagged-vlans.description:
Enable/disable automatic inclusion of untagged VLANs.   
disable:Disable automatic inclusion of untagged VLANs.   
enable:Enable automatic inclusion of untagged VLANs.

guest-vlan.description:
Enable the guest VLAN feature to allow limited access to non-802.1X-compliant clients.   
disable:Disable guest VLAN on this interface.   
enable:Enable guest VLAN on this interface.

auth-fail-vlan.description:
Enable to allow limited access to clients that cannot authenticate.   
disable:Disable authentication fail VLAN on this interface.   
enable:Enable authentication fail VLAN on this interface.

auth-fail-vlan-id.description: VLAN ID on which authentication failed.

framevid-apply.description:
Enable/disable the capability to apply the EAP/MAB frame VLAN to the port native VLAN.   
disable:Disable the capability to apply the EAP/MAB frame VLAN to the port native VLAN.   
enable:Enable the capability to apply the EAP/MAB frame VLAN to the port native VLAN.

radius-timeout-overwrite.description:
Enable to override the global RADIUS session timeout.   
disable:Override the global RADIUS session timeout.   
enable:Use the global RADIUS session timeout.

authserver-timeout-period.description: Authentication server timeout period (3 - 15 sec, default = 3).

authserver-timeout-vlan.description:
Enable/disable the authentication server timeout VLAN to allow limited access when RADIUS is unavailable.   
disable:Disable authentication server timeout VLAN on this interface.   
enable:Enable authentication server timeout VLAN on this interface.

authserver-timeout-tagged.description:
Configure timeout option for the tagged VLAN which allows limited access when the authentication server is unavailable.   
disable:Disable authentication server timeout on this interface.   
lldp-voice:LLDP voice timeout for the tagged VLAN on this interface.   
static:Static timeout for the tagged VLAN on this interface.

authserver-timeout-tagged-vlanid.description: Tagged VLAN name for which the timeout option is applied to (only one VLAN ID).

dacl.description:
Enable/disable dynamic access control list on this interface.   
disable:Disable dynamic access control list on this interface.   
enable:Enable dynamic access control on this interface.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Possible parameters to go in the body for the request

security-mode.description:
Port or MAC based 802.1X security mode.   
802.1X:802.1X port based authentication.   
802.1X-mac-based:802.1X MAC based authentication.

user-group.description: Name of user-group to assign to this MAC Authentication Bypass (MAB) policy.

mac-auth-bypass.description:
Enable/disable MAB for this policy.   
disable:Disable MAB.   
enable:Enable MAB.

auth-order.description:
Configure authentication order.   
dot1x-mab:Use EAP 1X authentication first then MAB.   
mab-dot1x:Use MAB authentication first then EAP 1X.   
mab:Use MAB authentication only.

auth-priority.description:
Configure authentication priority.   
legacy:EAP 1X authentication has a higher priority than MAB with the legacy implementation.   
dot1x-mab:EAP 1X authentication has a higher priority than MAB.   
mab-dot1x:MAB authentication has a higher priority than EAP 1X.

open-auth.description:
Enable/disable open authentication for this policy.   
disable:Disable open authentication.   
enable:Enable open authentication.

eap-passthru.description:
Enable/disable EAP pass-through mode, allowing protocols (such as LLDP) to pass through ports for more flexible authentication.   
disable:Disable EAP pass-through mode on this interface.   
enable:Enable EAP pass-through mode on this interface.

eap-auto-untagged-vlans.description:
Enable/disable automatic inclusion of untagged VLANs.   
disable:Disable automatic inclusion of untagged VLANs.   
enable:Enable automatic inclusion of untagged VLANs.

guest-vlan.description:
Enable the guest VLAN feature to allow limited access to non-802.1X-compliant clients.   
disable:Disable guest VLAN on this interface.   
enable:Enable guest VLAN on this interface.

auth-fail-vlan.description:
Enable to allow limited access to clients that cannot authenticate.   
disable:Disable authentication fail VLAN on this interface.   
enable:Enable authentication fail VLAN on this interface.

auth-fail-vlan-id.description: VLAN ID on which authentication failed.

framevid-apply.description:
Enable/disable the capability to apply the EAP/MAB frame VLAN to the port native VLAN.   
disable:Disable the capability to apply the EAP/MAB frame VLAN to the port native VLAN.   
enable:Enable the capability to apply the EAP/MAB frame VLAN to the port native VLAN.

radius-timeout-overwrite.description:
Enable to override the global RADIUS session timeout.   
disable:Override the global RADIUS session timeout.   
enable:Use the global RADIUS session timeout.

authserver-timeout-period.description: Authentication server timeout period (3 - 15 sec, default = 3).

authserver-timeout-vlan.description:
Enable/disable the authentication server timeout VLAN to allow limited access when RADIUS is unavailable.   
disable:Disable authentication server timeout VLAN on this interface.   
enable:Enable authentication server timeout VLAN on this interface.

authserver-timeout-tagged.description:
Configure timeout option for the tagged VLAN which allows limited access when the authentication server is unavailable.   
disable:Disable authentication server timeout on this interface.   
lldp-voice:LLDP voice timeout for the tagged VLAN on this interface.   
static:Static timeout for the tagged VLAN on this interface.

authserver-timeout-tagged-vlanid.description: Tagged VLAN name for which the timeout option is applied to (only one VLAN ID).

dacl.description:
Enable/disable dynamic access control list on this interface.   
disable:Disable dynamic access control list on this interface.   
enable:Enable dynamic access control on this interface.

8.description:

Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

description.description: Description for the Dynamic port policy.

fortilink.description: FortiLink interface for which this Dynamic port policy belongs to.

policy.description: Port policies with matching criteria and actions.

status.description:
Enable/disable policy.   
enable:Enable policy.   
disable:Disable policy.

category.description:
Category of Dynamic port policy.   
device:Device category.   
interface-tag:Interface Tag category.

match-type.description:
Match and retain the devices based on the type.   
dynamic:Matched devices will be removed on dynamic events like link-down,device-inactivity,switch-offline.   
override:Matched devices will be retained until the match-period.

match-period.description: Number of days the matched devices will be retained (0 - 120, 0 = always retain).

match-remove.description:
Options to remove the matched override devices.   
default:Remove the matched override devices based on the match period.   
link-down:Remove the matched override devices based on switch port link down event.

interface-tags.description: Match policy based on the FortiSwitch interface object tags.

mac.description: Match policy based on MAC address.

hw-vendor.description: Match policy based on hardware vendor.

type.description: Match policy based on type.

lldp-profile.description: LLDP profile to be applied when using this policy.

qos-policy.description: QoS policy to be applied when using this policy.

802-1x.description: 802.1x security policy to be applied when using this policy.

vlan-policy.description: VLAN policy to be applied when using this policy.

bounce-port-link.description:
Enable/disable bouncing (administratively bring the link down, up) of a switch port where this policy is applied. Helps to clear and reassign VLAN from lldp-profile.   
disable:Disable bouncing (administratively bring the link down, up) of a switch port where this policy is applied.   
enable:Enable bouncing (administratively bring the link down, up) of a switch port where this policy is applied.

bounce-port-duration.description: Bounce duration in seconds of a switch port where this policy is applied.

poe-reset.description:
Enable/disable POE reset of a switch port where this policy is applied.   
disable:Disable POE reset of a switch port where this policy is applied.   
enable:Enable POE reset of a switch port where this policy is applied.

sample-mode.description:
Configure sample mode for the flow tracking.   
local:Set local mode which samples on the specific switch port.   
perimeter:Set perimeter mode which samples on all switch fabric ports and fortilink port at the ingress.   
device-ingress:Set device -ingress mode which samples across all switch ports at the ingress.

sample-rate.description: Configure sample rate for the perimeter and device-ingress sampling(0 - 99999).

format.description:
Configure flow tracking protocol.   
netflow1:Netflow version 1 sampling.   
netflow5:Netflow version 5 sampling.   
netflow9:Netflow version 9 sampling.   
ipfix:Ipfix sampling.

ip.description: Collector IP address.

port.description: Collector port number(0-65535, default:0, netflow:2055, ipfix:4739).

transport.description:
Collector L4 transport protocol for exporting packets.   
udp:UDP protocol.   
tcp:TCP protocol.   
sctp:SCTP protocol.

level.description:
Configure flow tracking level.   
vlan:Collects srcip/dstip/srcport/dstport/protocol/tos/vlan from the sample packet.   
ip:Collects srcip/dstip from the sample packet.   
port:Collects srcip/dstip/srcport/dstport/protocol from the sample packet.   
proto:Collects srcip/dstip/protocol from the sample packet.   
mac:Collects smac/dmac from the sample packet.

max-export-pkt-size.description: Configure flow max export packet size (512-9216, default=512 bytes).

template-export-period.description: Configure template export period (1-60, default=5 minutes).

timeout-general.description: Configure flow session general timeout (60-604800, default=3600 seconds).

timeout-icmp.description: Configure flow session ICMP timeout (60-604800, default=300 seconds).

timeout-max.description: Configure flow session max timeout (60-604800, default=604800 seconds).

timeout-tcp.description: Configure flow session TCP timeout (60-604800, default=3600 seconds).

timeout-tcp-fin.description: Configure flow session TCP FIN timeout (60-604800, default=300 seconds).

get.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: wifi

mac-aging-interval.description: Time after which an inactive MAC is aged out (10 - 1000000 sec, default = 300, 0 = disable).

https-image-push.description:
Enable/disable image push to FortiSwitch using HTTPS.   
enable:Enable image push to FortiSwitch using HTTPS.   
disable:Disable image push to FortiSwitch using HTTPS.

vlan-all-mode.description:
VLAN configuration mode, user-defined-vlans or all-possible-vlans.   
all:Include all possible VLANs (1-4093).   
defined:Include user defined VLANs.

vlan-optimization.description:
FortiLink VLAN optimization.   
prune:Enable VLAN optimization (only VLANs necessary on or along path between destinations) on FortiSwitch units for auto-generated trunks.   
configured:Enable VLAN optimization (only VLANs created on Fortilink interface) on FortiSwitch units for auto-generated trunks.   
none:Disable VLAN optimization on FortiSwitch units for auto-generated trunks.

vlan-identity.description:
Identity of the VLAN. Commonly used for RADIUS Tunnel-Private-Group-Id.   
description:Configure the VLAN description to that of the FortiOS interface description if available; otherwise use the interface name.   
name:Configure the VLAN description to that of the FortiOS interface name.

mac-retention-period.description: Time in hours after which an inactive MAC is removed from client DB (0 = aged out based on mac-aging-interval).

default-virtual-switch-vlan.description: Default VLAN for ports when added to the virtual-switch.

dhcp-server-access-list.description:
Enable/disable DHCP snooping server access list.   
enable:Enable DHCP server access list.   
disable:Disable DHCP server access list.

dhcp-option82-format.description:
DHCP option-82 format string.   
ascii:Allow user to choose values for circuit-id and remote-id.
	  Format:  cid= [hostname,interface,mode,vlan,description] rid=[hostname,xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx,ip]
   
legacy:Generate predefine fixed format for circuit-id and remote.
	Format: cid=hostname-[<vlan:16><mod:8><port:8>].32bit, rid= [mac(0..6)].48bit

dhcp-option82-circuit-id.description:
List the parameters to be included to inform about client identification.   
intfname:Interface name.   
vlan:VLAN name.   
hostname:Hostname.   
mode:Mode.   
description:Description.

dhcp-option82-remote-id.description:
List the parameters to be included to inform about client identification.   
mac:MAC address.   
hostname:Hostname.   
ip:IP address.

dhcp-snoop-client-req.description:
Client DHCP packet broadcast mode.   
drop-untrusted:Broadcast packets on trusted ports in the VLAN.   
forward-untrusted:Broadcast packets on all ports in the VLAN.

dhcp-snoop-client-db-exp.description: Expiry time for DHCP snooping server database entries (300 - 259200 sec, default = 86400 sec).

dhcp-snoop-db-per-port-learn-limit.description: Per Interface dhcp-server entries learn limit (0 - 1024, default = 64).

log-mac-limit-violations.description:
Enable/disable logs for Learning Limit Violations.   
enable:Enable Learn Limit Violation.   
disable:Disable Learn Limit Violation.

mac-violation-timer.description: Set timeout for Learning Limit Violations (0 = disabled).

sn-dns-resolution.description:
Enable/disable DNS resolution of the FortiSwitch unit's IP address with switch name.   
enable:Enable DNS resolution of the FortiSwitch unit's IP address with switch name.   
disable:Disable DNS resolution of the FortiSwitch unit's IP address with switch name.

mac-event-logging.description:
Enable/disable MAC address event logging.   
enable:Enable MAC address event logging.   
disable:Disable MAC address event logging.

bounce-quarantined-link.description:
Enable/disable bouncing (administratively bring the link down, up) of a switch port where a quarantined device was seen last. Helps to re-initiate the DHCP process for a device.   
disable:Disable bouncing (administratively bring the link down, up) of a switch port where a quarantined device was seen last.   
enable:Enable bouncing (administratively bring the link down, up) of a switch port where a quarantined device was seen last.

quarantine-mode.description:
Quarantine mode.   
by-vlan:Quarantined device traffic is sent to FortiGate on a separate quarantine VLAN.   
by-redirect:Quarantined device traffic is redirected only to the FortiGate on the received VLAN.

update-user-device.description:
Control which sources update the device user list.   
mac-cache:Update MAC address from switch-controller mac-cache.   
lldp:Update from FortiSwitch LLDP neighbor database.   
dhcp-snooping:Update from FortiSwitch DHCP snooping client and server databases.   
l2-db:Update from FortiSwitch Network-monitor Layer 2 tracking database.   
l3-db:Update from FortiSwitch Network-monitor Layer 3 tracking database.

custom-command.description: List of custom commands to be pushed to all FortiSwitches in the VDOM.

command-name.description: Name of custom command to push to all FortiSwitches in VDOM.

fips-enforce.description:
Enable/disable enforcement of FIPS on managed FortiSwitch devices.   
disable:Disable enforcement of FIPS on managed FortiSwitch devices.   
enable:Enable enforcement of FIPS on managed FortiSwitch devices.

firmware-provision-on-authorization.description:
Enable/disable automatic provisioning of latest firmware on authorization.   
enable:Enable firmware provision on authorization.   
disable:Disable firmware provision on authorization.

switch-on-deauth.description:
No-operation/Factory-reset the managed FortiSwitch on deauthorization.   
no-op:No-operation on the managed FortiSwitch on deauthorization.   
factory-reset:Factory-reset the managed FortiSwitch on deauthorization.

firewall-auth-user-hold-period.description: Time period in minutes to hold firewall authenticated MAC users (5 - 1440, default = 5, disable = 0).

enable:Enable DHCP server access list.   
disable:Disable DHCP server access list.

dhcp-option82-format.description:
DHCP option-82 format string.   
ascii:Allow user to choose values for circuit-id and remote-id.
	  Format:  cid= [hostname,interface,mode,vlan,description] rid=[hostname,xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx,ip]
   
legacy:Generate predefine fixed format for circuit-id and remote.
	Format: cid=hostname-[<vlan:16><mod:8><port:8>].32bit, rid= [mac(0..6)].48bit

dhcp-option82-circuit-id.description:
List the parameters to be included to inform about client identification.   
intfname:Interface name.   
vlan:VLAN name.   
hostname:Hostname.   
mode:Mode.   
description:Description.

dhcp-option82-remote-id.description:
List the parameters to be included to inform about client identification.   
mac:MAC address.   
hostname:Hostname.   
ip:IP address.

dhcp-snoop-client-req.description:
Client DHCP packet broadcast mode.   
drop-untrusted:Broadcast packets on trusted ports in the VLAN.   
forward-untrusted:Broadcast packets on all ports in the VLAN.

dhcp-snoop-client-db-exp.description: Expiry time for DHCP snooping server database entries (300 - 259200 sec, default = 86400 sec).

dhcp-snoop-db-per-port-learn-limit.description: Per Interface dhcp-server entries learn limit (0 - 1024, default = 64).

log-mac-limit-violations.description:
Enable/disable logs for Learning Limit Violations.   
enable:Enable Learn Limit Violation.   
disable:Disable Learn Limit Violation.

mac-violation-timer.description: Set timeout for Learning Limit Violations (0 = disabled).

sn-dns-resolution.description:
Enable/disable DNS resolution of the FortiSwitch unit's IP address with switch name.   
enable:Enable DNS resolution of the FortiSwitch unit's IP address with switch name.   
disable:Disable DNS resolution of the FortiSwitch unit's IP address with switch name.

mac-event-logging.description:
Enable/disable MAC address event logging.   
enable:Enable MAC address event logging.   
disable:Disable MAC address event logging.

bounce-quarantined-link.description:
Enable/disable bouncing (administratively bring the link down, up) of a switch port where a quarantined device was seen last. Helps to re-initiate the DHCP process for a device.   
disable:Disable bouncing (administratively bring the link down, up) of a switch port where a quarantined device was seen last.   
enable:Enable bouncing (administratively bring the link down, up) of a switch port where a quarantined device was seen last.

quarantine-mode.description:
Quarantine mode.   
by-vlan:Quarantined device traffic is sent to FortiGate on a separate quarantine VLAN.   
by-redirect:Quarantined device traffic is redirected only to the FortiGate on the received VLAN.

update-user-device.description:
Control which sources update the device user list.   
mac-cache:Update MAC address from switch-controller mac-cache.   
lldp:Update from FortiSwitch LLDP neighbor database.   
dhcp-snooping:Update from FortiSwitch DHCP snooping client and server databases.   
l2-db:Update from FortiSwitch Network-monitor Layer 2 tracking database.   
l3-db:Update from FortiSwitch Network-monitor Layer 3 tracking database.

custom-command.description: List of custom commands to be pushed to all FortiSwitches in the VDOM.

command-name.description: Name of custom command to push to all FortiSwitches in VDOM.

fips-enforce.description:
Enable/disable enforcement of FIPS on managed FortiSwitch devices.   
disable:Disable enforcement of FIPS on managed FortiSwitch devices.   
enable:Enable enforcement of FIPS on managed FortiSwitch devices.

firmware-provision-on-authorization.description:
Enable/disable automatic provisioning of latest firmware on authorization.   
enable:Enable firmware provision on authorization.   
disable:Disable firmware provision on authorization.

switch-on-deauth.description:
No-operation/Factory-reset the managed FortiSwitch on deauthorization.   
no-op:No-operation on the managed FortiSwitch on deauthorization.   
factory-reset:Factory-reset the managed FortiSwitch on deauthorization.

firewall-auth-user-hold-period.description: Time period in minutes to hold firewall authenticated MAC users (5 - 1440, default = 5, disable = 0).

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

Enable/disable MCLAG inter chassis link.   
disable:Disable auto inter-switch-LAG.   
enable:Enable auto inter-switch-LAG.

enable:Enable VLAN assignment when this profile is applied on port.

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: mkey

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

get.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: wifi

tx-hold.description: Number of tx-intervals before local LLDP data expires (1 - 16, default = 4). Packet TTL is tx-hold * tx-interval.

tx-interval.description: Frequency of LLDP PDU transmission from FortiSwitch (5 - 4095 sec, default = 30). Packet TTL is tx-hold * tx-interval.

fast-start-interval.description: Frequency of LLDP PDU transmission from FortiSwitch for the first 4 packets when the link is up (2 - 5 sec, default = 2, 0 = disable fast start).

management-interface.description:
Primary management interface to be advertised in LLDP and CDP PDUs.   
internal:Use internal interface.   
mgmt:Use management interface.

device-detection.description:
Enable/disable dynamic detection of LLDP neighbor devices for VLAN assignment.   
disable:Disable dynamic detection of LLDP neighbor devices.   
enable:Enable dynamic detection of LLDP neighbor devices.

fast-start-interval.description: Frequency of LLDP PDU transmission from FortiSwitch for the first 4 packets when the link is up (2 - 5 sec, default = 2, 0 = disable fast start).

management-interface.description:
Primary management interface to be advertised in LLDP and CDP PDUs.   
internal:Use internal interface.   
mgmt:Use management interface.

device-detection.description:
Enable/disable dynamic detection of LLDP neighbor devices for VLAN assignment.   
disable:Disable dynamic detection of LLDP neighbor devices.   
enable:Enable dynamic detection of LLDP neighbor devices.

8.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

8.name: filter
8.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

26.name: vdom
26.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: nkey
parameters.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

400.description: Bad Request: Request cannot be processed by the API

404.description: Resource Not Found: Unable to find the specified resource.

parameters.name: attr
parameters.description: Attribute name that references other table

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

parameters.name: skip_to_datasource
parameters.description: Skip to provided table's Nth entry. E.g {datasource: 'firewall.address', pos: 10, global_entry: false}

parameters.name: acs
parameters.description: If true, returned result are in ascending order.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: If present, the objects will be filtered by the search value.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Scope [global|vdom|both*]

parameters.name: datasource
parameters.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

parameters.name: with_meta
parameters.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
datasource: Return all applicable datasource entries for a specific attribute based on simulate data.
stats: Return CMDB aggregated statistics.
find-index: Return indexes of provided primary keys with respect to filter.
default: Return the CLI default values for this object type.
json-schema: Return the JSON Schema for this object type.
schema: Return the CLI schema for this object type.
revision: Return the CMDB revision for this object type.
transaction-list: List all configuration transaction(s).
transaction-show: Show the content of the configuration transaction by transcation ID.

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: switch-id
parameters.description: mkey

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

429.description: Access temporarily blocked: Maximum failed authentications reached. The offended source is temporarily blocked for certain amount of time.

500.description: Internal Server Error: Internal error when processing the request

8.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

26.name: vdom
26.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: nkey
parameters.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

aes128:CFB128-AES-128 symmetric encryption protocol.   
aes192:CFB128-AES-192 symmetric encryption protocol.   
aes192c:CFB128-AES-192-C symmetric encryption protocol.   
aes256:CFB128-AES-256 symmetric encryption protocol.   
aes256c:CFB128-AES-256-C symmetric encryption protocol.   
des:CBC-DES symmetric encryption protocol.

description.description: Description of the storm control policy.

storm-control-mode.description:
Set Storm control mode.   
global:Apply Global or switch level storm control configuration.   
override:Override global and switch level storm control to use port level configuration.   
disabled:Disable storm control on the port entirely overriding global and switch level storm control.

rate.description: Threshold rate in packets per second at which storm traffic is controlled in override mode (default=500, 0 to drop all).

burst-size-level.description: Increase level to handle bursty traffic (0 - 4, default = 0).

unknown-unicast.description:
Enable/disable storm control to drop/allow unknown unicast traffic in override mode.   
enable:Enable storm control for unknown unicast traffic to drop packets which exceed configured rate limits.   
disable:Disable storm control for unknown unicast traffic to allow all packets.

unknown-multicast.description:
Enable/disable storm control to drop/allow unknown multicast traffic in override mode.   
enable:Enable storm control for unknown multicast traffic to drop packets which exceed configured rate limits.   
disable:Disable storm control for unknown multicast traffic to allow all packets.

broadcast.description:
Enable/disable storm control to drop/allow broadcast traffic in override mode.   
enable:Enable storm control for broadcast traffic to drop packets which exceed configured rate limits.   
disable:Disable storm control for broadcast traffic to allow all packets.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Possible parameters to go in the body for the request

description.description: Description of the storm control policy.

storm-control-mode.description:
Set Storm control mode.   
global:Apply Global or switch level storm control configuration.   
override:Override global and switch level storm control to use port level configuration.   
disabled:Disable storm control on the port entirely overriding global and switch level storm control.

rate.description: Threshold rate in packets per second at which storm traffic is controlled in override mode (default=500, 0 to drop all).

burst-size-level.description: Increase level to handle bursty traffic (0 - 4, default = 0).

unknown-unicast.description:
Enable/disable storm control to drop/allow unknown unicast traffic in override mode.   
enable:Enable storm control for unknown unicast traffic to drop packets which exceed configured rate limits.   
disable:Disable storm control for unknown unicast traffic to allow all packets.

unknown-multicast.description:
Enable/disable storm control to drop/allow unknown multicast traffic in override mode.   
enable:Enable storm control for unknown multicast traffic to drop packets which exceed configured rate limits.   
disable:Disable storm control for unknown multicast traffic to allow all packets.

broadcast.description:
Enable/disable storm control to drop/allow broadcast traffic in override mode.   
enable:Enable storm control for broadcast traffic to drop packets which exceed configured rate limits.   
disable:Disable storm control for broadcast traffic to allow all packets.

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

8.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

parallel-process-override.description:
Enable/disable parallel process override.   
disable:Disable maximum parallel process override.   
enable:Enable maximum parallel process override.

data-sync-interval.description: Time interval between collection of switch data (30 - 1800 sec, default = 60, 0 = disable).

iot-weight-threshold.description: MAC entry's confidence value. Value is re-queried when below this value (default = 1, 0 = disable).

iot-scan-interval.description: IoT scan interval (2 - 10080 mins, default = 60 mins, 0 = disable).

iot-holdoff.description: MAC entry's creation time. Time must be greater than this value for an entry to be created (0 - 10080 mins, default = 5 mins).

iot-mac-idle.description: MAC entry's idle time. MAC entry is removed after this value (0 - 10080 mins, default = 1440 mins).

nac-periodic-interval.description: Periodic time interval to run NAC engine (5 - 180 sec, default = 60).

dynamic-periodic-interval.description: Periodic time interval to run Dynamic port policy engine (5 - 180 sec, default = 60).

tunnel-mode.description:
Compatible/strict tunnel mode.   
compatible:Least restrictive. Supports the lowest levels of security but highest compatibility between all FortiSwitch and FortiGate devices. 3rd party certificates permitted.   
moderate:Moderate level of security. 3rd party certificates permitted.   
strict:Highest level of security requirements. If enabled, the FortiGate device follows the same security mode requirements as in FIPS/CC mode.

caputp-echo-interval.description: Echo interval for the caputp echo requests from swtp.

caputp-max-retransmit.description: Maximum retransmission count for the caputp tunnel packets.

parameters.description: Possible parameters to go in the body for the request

parallel-process-override.description:
Enable/disable parallel process override.   
disable:Disable maximum parallel process override.   
enable:Enable maximum parallel process override.

data-sync-interval.description: Time interval between collection of switch data (30 - 1800 sec, default = 60, 0 = disable).

iot-weight-threshold.description: MAC entry's confidence value. Value is re-queried when below this value (default = 1, 0 = disable).

iot-scan-interval.description: IoT scan interval (2 - 10080 mins, default = 60 mins, 0 = disable).

iot-holdoff.description: MAC entry's creation time. Time must be greater than this value for an entry to be created (0 - 10080 mins, default = 5 mins).

iot-mac-idle.description: MAC entry's idle time. MAC entry is removed after this value (0 - 10080 mins, default = 1440 mins).

nac-periodic-interval.description: Periodic time interval to run NAC engine (5 - 180 sec, default = 60).

dynamic-periodic-interval.description: Periodic time interval to run Dynamic port policy engine (5 - 180 sec, default = 60).

tunnel-mode.description:
Compatible/strict tunnel mode.   
compatible:Least restrictive. Supports the lowest levels of security but highest compatibility between all FortiSwitch and FortiGate devices. 3rd party certificates permitted.   
moderate:Moderate level of security. 3rd party certificates permitted.   
strict:Highest level of security requirements. If enabled, the FortiGate device follows the same security mode requirements as in FIPS/CC mode.

caputp-echo-interval.description: Echo interval for the caputp echo requests from swtp.

caputp-max-retransmit.description: Maximum retransmission count for the caputp tunnel packets.

400.description: Bad Request: Request cannot be processed by the API

401.description: Not Authorized: Request without successful login session

403.description: Forbidden: Request is missing CSRF token or administrator is missing access profile permissions.

404.description: Resource Not Found: Unable to find the specified resource.

405.description: Method Not Allowed: Specified HTTP method is not allowed for this resource.

413.description: Request Entity Too Large: Request cannot be processed due to large entity

424.description: Failed Dependency: Fail dependency can be duplicate resource, missing required parameter, missing required attribute, invalid attribute value

429.description: Access temporarily blocked: Maximum failed authentications reached. The offended source is temporarily blocked for certain amount of time.

500.description: Internal Server Error: Internal error when processing the request

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Possible parameters to go in the body for the request

fortilink.description: FortiLink interface for which this VLAN policy belongs to.

vlan.description: Native VLAN to be applied when using this VLAN policy.

allowed-vlans.description: Allowed VLANs to be applied when using this VLAN policy.

untagged-vlans.description: Untagged VLANs to be applied when using this VLAN policy.

allowed-vlans-all.description:
Enable/disable all defined VLANs when using this VLAN policy.   
enable:Enable all defined VLANs.   
disable:Disable all defined VLANs.

discard-mode.description:
Discard mode to be applied when using this VLAN policy.   
none:Discard disabled.   
all-untagged:Discard all frames that are untagged.   
all-tagged:Discard all frames that are tagged.

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: nkey
parameters.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom
